items.sentence: Why wouldn\'t you let me tell you what happened?
I didn\'t understand the teacher\'s explanation.
Tom and Mary went to the jewelry store together.
What are you going to wear to the party tonight?
What kind of dressing do you want on your salad?
Tom really should be getting ready for his trip.
I\'ve already told Tom what\'ll probably happen.
Against my advice, he fed his dog some raw pork.
Air is primarily made up of nitrogen and oxygen.
All I know is that Tom was here with me at 2:30.
I\'m not sure, but I think Tom wants to do that.
I\'m not the one who talked Tom into doing that.
I\'ve lost three pounds in the last three weeks.
In the morning, I was woken up by the telephone.
Tom never speaks French without making mistakes.
Tom never wanted to go there in the first place.
Tom snuck out and had a few beers with the guys.
Tom soon realized Mary had stolen all his money.
Tom speaks French too fast for me to understand.
Tom spent all morning in the interrogation room.
